To estimate reasonable bounds on the possible effects of climate and antigenicity on epidemic size, we used a Bayesian hierarchical model that partially pooled effect-size estimates across subtypes, increasing the capacity to detect any potential effects without assuming a priori that effects should be the same across different subtypes. We fit the model using Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) with Stan
54 and its R interface rstan
55 ; Stan implements a no-u-turn sampler (NUTS)
54 . All data and code needed to reproduce the analysis and figures are provided in the project Github repository, along with directions in a README file.
